intro: Stylidium bellum, commonly known as the fairy lantern, is a small, herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its striking, colorful flowers that range from red to orange. The plant has a short, upright stem with narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are borne in dense, spike-like clusters and are pollinated primarily by insects. Stylidium bellum is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
